snippet: Ng Lap Seng, who was indicted on charges that he bribed a former U.N. official, must satisfy additional conditions before he is released into home detention, a federal judge ruled.
abstract: Federal Judge Vernon S Broderick rules Chinese billionaire Ng Lap Seng will be released to home detention if he agrees to number of conditions to reduce chances he will flee country; Ng has been indicted for bribing former United Nations General Assembly president John W Ashe in return for his influence on business projects in Antigua and China.
lead_paragraph: Ng Lap Seng, who was indicted on charges that he bribed a former U.N. official, must satisfy additional conditions before he is released into home detention, a federal judge ruled.

headline.print_headline: Bail With Stricter Conditions Is Set for Chinese Billionaire
headline.main: Bail With Stricter Conditions Is Set for Chinese Billionaire
